prayers.name: St. Faustina's Prayer for Sinners
prayers.text: O Jesus, eternal Truth, our Life, I call upon You and I beg Your mercy for poor sinners. O sweetest Heart of my Lord, full of pity and unfathomable mercy, I plead with You for poor sinners. O Most Sacred Heart, Fount of Mercy from which gush forth rays of inconceivable graces upon the entire human race, I beg of You light for poor sinners. O Jesus, be mindful of Your own bitter Passion and do not permit the loss of souls redeemed at so dear a price of Your most precious Blood. O Jesus, when I consider the great price of Your Blood, I rejoice at its immensity, for one drop alone would have been enough for the salvation of all sinners. Although sin is an abyss of wickedness and ingratitude, the price paid for us can never be equalled. Therefore, let every soul trust in the Passion of the Lord, and place its hope in His mercy. God will not deny His mercy to anyone. Heaven and earth may change, but God's mercy will never be exhausted. Oh, what immense joy burns in my heart when I contemplate Your incomprehensible goodness, O Jesus! I desire to bring all sinners to Your feet that they may glorify Your mercy throughout endless ages.

prayers.name: St. Faustina's Prayer for Sinners
prayers.text: O Iesu, aeterna Veritas, Vita nostra, invoco Te et misericordiam tuam obsecro pro miseris peccatoribus. O dulcissimum Cor Domini mei, plena pietatis et misericordiae immensae, obsecro Te pro miseris peccatoribus. O Sacratissimum Cor, Fons Misericordiae, ex quo manant radii gratiae incomprehensibilis super omne genus humanum, oro Te, da lucem peccatoribus. O Iesu, memor esto passionis Tuae amarae et ne sinas perire animas redemptas tam pretioso sanguine Tuo. O Iesu, dum considero immensum pretium Sanguinis Tui, laetor in eius immensitate, nam una gutta sufficeret ad salutem omnium peccatorum. Etsi peccatum abyssus est nequitiae et ingratitudinis, pretium pro nobis datum numquam aequabitur. Ergo, omnis anima confidat in Passione Domini et spem suam in misericordia Eius ponat. Deus nemini misericordiam suam negabit. Caelum et terra mutari possunt, sed misericordia Dei numquam exhaurietur. O, quanta gaudia in corde meo ardeant dum benignitatem tuam incomprehensibilem considero, O Iesu! Cupio omnes peccatores ad pedes Tuos adducere, ut misericordiam tuam glorificent per saecula saeculorum.

prayers.name: Divine Mercy, Opening Prayer
prayers.text: You expired, Jesus, but the source of life gushed forth for souls, and the ocean of mercy opened up for the whole world. O Fount of Life, unfathomable Divine Mercy, envelop the whole world and empty Yourself out upon us.

prayers.name: Divine Mercy, Opening Prayer
prayers.text: Expirasti, Iesu, sed fons vitae pro animabus erupit, et oceanus misericordiæ pro toto mundo aperuit se. O fons vitæ, incomprehensibilis misericordia divina, involve mundum universum et effunde te in nos.

prayers.name: O Blood and Water
prayers.text: O Blood and Water, which gushed forth from the Heart of Jesus as a fountain of Mercy for us, I trust in You!

prayers.name: O Blood and Water
prayers.text: O Sanguis et Aqua, quae ex corde Iesu in fontem misericordiae pro nobis emanaverunt, in Te confido!

prayers.name: Eternal Father
prayers.text: Eternal Father, I offer You the Body and Blood, Soul and Divinity of Your dearly beloved Son, Our Lord Jesus Christ, in atonement for our sins and those of the whole world.

prayers.name: Eternal Father
prayers.text: Pater aeternæ, offero Tibi Corpus et Sanguinem, Animam et Divinitatem dilectissimi Filii Tui, Domini nostri Iesu Christi, pro peccatis nostris et totius mundi.

prayers.name: For the Sake of His Sorrowful Passion
prayers.text: For the sake of His sorrowful Passion, have mercy on us and on the whole world.

prayers.name: For the Sake of His Sorrowful Passion
prayers.text: Propter dolorem passionis eius, miserere nobis et totius mundi.

prayers.name: Holy God (Trisagion)
prayers.text: Holy God, Holy Mighty One, Holy Immortal One, have mercy on us and on the whole world.

prayers.name: Holy God (Trisagion)
prayers.text: Sanctus Deus, Sanctus Fortis, Sanctus Immortalis, miserere nobis et totius mundi.

prayers.name: Divine Mercy, Closing Prayer
prayers.text: Eternal God, in whom mercy is endless and the treasury of compassion inexhaustible, look kindly upon us and increase Your mercy in us, that in difficult moments we might not despair nor become despondent, but with great confidence submit ourselves to Your holy will, which is Love and Mercy itself.

prayers.name: Divine Mercy, Closing Prayer
prayers.text: Deus aeternæ, in quo misericordia infinita est et thesaurus pietatis inexhaustus, respice propitius nos et auge in nobis misericordiam tuam, ut in momentis difficilibus non deficiamus neque desperemus, sed cum magna fiducia nosmetipsos submittamus sanctissimae voluntati tuae, quae est Amor et Misericordia ipsa.
